result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake A Berry

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Defendant Blake A Berry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

State advises that there is an offer that would amend to a non-criminal ticket upon proof of community service. Defendant does not have proof today, but has completed it. Court sets another date.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Blake A Berry in court. 

Defendant is not currently represented by counsel. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant states he does not wish to have an attorney. 

State gives recitation of pre-trial offer. Upon completion of conditions, including community service and forfeiture of BB gun , State would amend to a non-criminal disposition. 

Court advises Defendant of Court appointed counsel. Defendant does not wish to be represented and wishes to accept the State's offer. 

Court will set over for further proceeding.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:36 AM Defendant Blake A Berry in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Blake A Berry
Current: 4062 N. 83rd St., Milwaukee, WI 53222   (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 4338 N 83rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53222
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 07/01/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
